jobDescription: The Consolidations Accountant will work on the Corporate Consolidations team supporting all of Match Group's global brands organize and understand the intercompany allocation process. Match Group, through its portfolio companies, is a leading provider of dating products available globally. Our portfolio of brands includes Tinder, Match, OkCupid, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, as well as a number of other brands, each designed to increase our users' likelihood of finding a meaningful connection. How you'll make an impact: You will work closely with Financial Planning, Tax, and General Ledger Accounting to streamline the various allocations and intercompany processes You will manage and run allocation tables in WorkDay accounting system and prepare monthly consolidations journal entries (Debt, Equity, Intercompany, Allocations, Transfer Pricing, Tax Provision, etc.) You will create and settle intercompany invoices, perform revaluations in WorkDay accounting system and assist with preparing rollforwards and reconciliations You will assist in the preparation of the quarterly financial reporting workbook and support schedules We could be a match if: You have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting and 1+ years of applicable experience You have experience with intercompany transactions You have worked with Balance Sheet and Income Statement analysis Experience with OneStream and WorkDay a plus What's the team like? In this role, you will report to the Direct of Corporate Consolidations, but will work closely with the Senior Accountant The team is incredibly collaborative and resourceful The team provides support to various members of the accounting organization (i.e. general ledger, payroll, tax, treasury, etc.) The staff accountants who succeed on this team are detail-oriented team players, able to work in a fast-paced environment who are flexible and willing to learn Why Match Group? Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too and understand the importance of all life's milestones. Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security Unplug – Generous PTO and 15 paid holidays so you can unplug Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts WFH Stipend – Hybrid/remote work allowance to help you feel comfortable and efficient in your home office environment Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other and build a sense of connection and belonging! We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. Period.

Match Group (MTCH) is seeking its first Legal Operations Manager to join the Match Group Business Affairs and Legal team. This is an exciting and strategic opportunity for a motivated legal operations professional to design, build, and implement a best-in-class Legal Operations function from the ground up at a top, global consumer facing technology company. Match Group, through its portfolio companies, is a leading provider of dating products available globally. Our portfolio of brands includes Tinder, Match, OkCupid, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, as well as a number of other brands, each designed to increase our users' likelihood of finding a meaningful connection. How you'll make an impact: You will assess the organization’s current legal operations capabilities and needs and propose and implement both short and long-term strategies to drive operations improvements having direct and meaningful impact across the entire department. You will oversee, improve, and streamline our current contract management systems and ensure proper entry and execution of all contracts in accordance with company policies. You’ll also assess opportunities to implement various new third party tools to support contract management with an eye toward efficiency, compliance, and ease-of-use in alignment with various cross functional teams including Finance, Accounting, IT, and others as appropriate. You will manage monthly forecasting and accruals processes for the department. You’ll also oversee and manage our billing processes and tools, including vendor set up and payments, and assure timely processing of vendor bills. You will have end-to-end responsibility for legal operations technology strategy, from the RFP stage through implementation and maintenance, with the Business Affairs and Legal Team, Finance and Accounting, and IT teams as your key stakeholders and partners. We could be a match if: You have 5+ years of experience managing complex projects, functions and tools for in-house legal departments. You have a demonstrated track record of assessing legal department needs, identifying solutions, and driving project management through completion to effect measurable change, all within established budgets and schedules and with clear stakeholder communication. You possess a strong understanding of legal systems and technologies and vendor management experience, including RFP and implementation processes. You have superior project management and organizational skills, with a demonstrated ability to track and analyze data to show results, and are effective in preparing and presenting presentations to a range of audiences. You are a strategic thinker and have the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision but also collaborate effectively within and across functions and build consensus. What's the team like? This position is fully remote. However, candidates who prefer an in-office environment and are located in the New York City, Dallas or Los Angeles metro areas where we have offices are welcome to work there. You will report to the Vice President & Associate General Counsel, Americas. Employees who succeed on this team are strategic thinkers who thrive in new situations and can simultaneously manage multiple demands and shifting priorities within a fast-paced, and rapidly evolving environment. The salary range for this position is $128,000- $155,000. Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in New York City. This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting. Why Match Group? Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too and understand the importance of all life's milestones. Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security Unplug – Generous PTO and 15 paid holidays so you can unplug Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts WFH Stipend – Hybrid/remote work allowance to help you feel comfortable and efficient in your home office environment Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other and build a sense of connection and belonging! We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. Period.

Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security Unplug – Generous PTO and 15 paid holidays so you can unplug Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts WFH Stipend – Hybrid/remote work allowance to help you feel comfortable and efficient in your home office environment Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other and build a sense of connection and belonging! Match Media Group is the marketing and advertising division within Match Group. Match Media builds and offers advertising solutions across category-leading brands focused on singles and first-time connections, including Tinder, Match.com, OKCupid, People Media, Plenty of Fish, Hinge, and over 25 other dating products, to help brands and agencies find innovative ways to reach passionate audiences and connect with their consumers. As a Yield Analyst, you’ll be responsible for monetization reporting and strategy analyses to maximize the value of the more than 3B impressions per month that are indirectly sold. You will collaborate with the Yield team to develop and deploy tactics driving up eCPMs across the portfolio of properties and ensure that all data is collected and tracked in an accurate and timely manner. When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL). We think the same is true for creating the best products, so we work together IRL in our NYC office 2-3 days/week. See you soon! How you’ll make an impact: You will compile daily figures from vendors by collecting data from multiple UIs, creating reports, and highlighting trends in addition to designing metrics and building, monitoring, and maintaining dashboards to track key revenue/monetization metrics for upper management You will work with the Direct Sales Team by maintaining reports on Private Marketplace stats and recommending optimizations You will help reduce missed opportunities by analyzing lost bid and advertiser bid landscape reports You will maintain ad quality integration across our portfolio of properties by leveraging Google GAM, tag QA, and site QA daily We could be a match if: You have completed your undergraduate degree in a quantitative field and have at least 1 year of work or internship experience, preferably with digital or programmatic advertising You have a strong proficiency in Excel and excellent analytical and problem solving skills (if you have Python experience, that’s even better!) You are a great communicator and can build rapport quickly with internal teams and external vendors, providing business guidance and recommendations based on insights What’s the Team like: In this role, you’ll be based in our New York office and report to our VP – Global Revenue Operations The Analysts who succeed on this team are curious problem solvers who work autonomously and take ownership of their work The members of this team like the fast-paced environment of programmatic advertising and share a love of films and TV (in fact, they’ll give you a whole list of recommendations if you need it!) The salary range for this position is $70,000 - $100,000. Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in New York City.
